# privx_secret (Resource)

PrivX Secret resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "privx_secret" "example" {
  name = "bar"
  data = jsonencode({})
  write_roles = [
    {
      id   = "4f22ba9d-d3a0-47f9-b5f8-0345e869e7ea"
      name = "role_[Default]_[ADMIN]"
    }
  ]
  read_roles = [
    {
      id   = "1379d493-e746-4308-608c-ba465b416787"
      name = "role_[Default]_[USER]"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Secret name (used as identifier)

### Optional

- `data` (Map of String, Sensitive) Secret data as key-value pairs
- `owner_id` (String) Owner ID of the secret
- `read_roles` (Attributes List) List of roles that can read this secret (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--read_roles))
- `write_roles` (Attributes List) List of roles that can write to this secret (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--write_roles))

### Read-Only

- `author` (String) Author of the secret
- `created` (String) Creation timestamp
- `id` (String) Secret ID (same as name)
- `path` (String) Secret path
- `updated` (String) Last update timestamp
- `updated_by` (String) ID of user who last updated the secret

<a id="nestedatt--read_roles"></a>
### Nested Schema for `read_roles`

Required:

- `id` (String) Role ID

Optional:

- `name` (String) Role name


<a id="nestedatt--write_roles"></a>
### Nested Schema for `write_roles`

Required:

- `id` (String) Role ID

Optional:

- `name` (String) Role name
